name: Return to Castle Wolfenstein
description: World War II rages and nations fall. SS head Himmler has Hitler's full backing to twist science and the occult into an army capable of annihilating the Allies once and for all. Battling alone, you're on an intense mission to pierce the black heart of the Third Reich and stop Himmler -- or die trying.
minimum_requirements: 3-D Hardware Accelerator (with 16MB VRAM with full OpenGL® support; Pentium® II 400 Mhz processor or Athlon® processor; English version of Windows® 2000/XP Operating System; 128 MB RAM; 16-bit high color video mode; 800 MB of uncompressed hard disk space for game files (Minimum Install), plus 300 MB for the Windows swap file; a 100% Windows® 2000/XP compatible computer system (including compatible 32-bit drivers for video card, sound card and input devices); 100% DirectX® 8.0a (included); 100% DirectX 3.0 or higher compatible sound card and drivers; 100% Microsoft-compatible mouse/keyboard and driver Multiplayer Requirements: Internet (TCP/IP) and LAN (TCP/IP and IPX) play supported, Internet play requires a 100% Windows 2000/XP compatible 56.6 Kbps (or faster) modem

reviews.review_text: Return to Castle Wolfenstien has been my favorite game every since I found my dad playing it when I was little. I would sit on his lap and watch him play. I've mastered this game and played custom maps or mods I even played with HD textures. This game has been my one time favorite I used to own it on disk or downloaded I geuss until one day I got this game on steam and now I have played it for a very long time. So I'd recommend you try this game out.

I played through the campaign several times when I was young and it was one of my favorites SP games at the time. I also remember playing MP which I really enjoyed. I don't think I have met anyone who havent played through this and called themselves a gamer!
BEST HISTORY ACCURATE WWII SHOOTER BOUT ONE MAN ARMY WHO BRINGS VICTORY TO MUERICA
One of the best games ever.  'the enemy is weakened'

+ Tony Jay + Intriguing plot + Landscape and surroundings + Pretty good war themed shooter + id Tech 3 engine + Stealth missions are quite fun + Soundtrack!  - little bit too short (~5 hours single player, I would definetly spend some more time in Castle Wolfenstein while killing nazi soldiers) - not many occasions to use some of the weapons (like the flamethrower)  Overall - Thumbs up, game worth playing.
A brilliant game where you kill Nazis, Zombies, Nazi WarMachines, and other ♥♥♥♥ like that. All in all it is a great and fun old school game! 10/10 (Still better than COD)
An instant classic.

RtcW is a game from yesteryear. Back before the days of regenerating health and scripted sequences. When the Quake 3 engine was still king and everyone still waited for Duke Nukem Forever.  Return to Castle Wolfenstein's most memorable element to me is its simplicity. It is very similar to Wolfy 3D in that you basically do two things in this game: Kill Nazis and find treasure. Infact it is to the game's benefit as it has aged startlingly well for a game from 2001. It encorporated elements like secret areas, treasure, eating food to restore your health etc, and added slightly more fantastical designs like mutants and zombies. RtcW is more linear than the previous game, but it has extremely good pacing and map design. You uncover shortcuts back to prior areas, and always feel in control in gunfights.  It's a shame RtcW isn't talked about as often as other games from it's era, since it is one of the best games Id ever published. A game that is just as epic as the name it carries.

10/10.Mutants,zombies and nazis a pefect combination of fun.I havent completed this yet but I once did with cheats:)The only problem I have with it is the stealth mechanics they didnt have alot of focus on it but its still realy good who dosent like stabbing nazis anyway?
Childhood.

There are some technical issues that come with older games like this (no widescreen resolutions, crashes, etc.) but once you can work through them you are in for one of the greatest FPSs ever made. It's a yes from me.

It almost made me cry playing this game again, especially thinking about the days back playing with my friends, on the same server, always hyped when i got from school, still playing it for nostalgic reason, but it was the first ever game i played, and it will always be my favourite.
i thought this game was the most amazing thing i have ever seen i thought that grafics were awesome and they still are nice looking cearn clean and well cut

There's nothing to say that hasn't already been said, it's a solid FPS from yesteryear.     Plenty of secrets to find    Broad arsenal of weapons    Funny guard dialogues    Tesla-powered cyborgs   Easily one of my favorite games.

One of my favourite games of all time by far. This game is just so greatly executed and creative as well as fun. I can't think of a single reason to get this game other than 1. Not a FPS fan. 2. Picky about Graphics. 3. Doesnt Run on your system. 4. Don't like games with 'Nazi's' featured in them 5. Just simply doesnt peak your interest.  I however love this game and everything about it and yes I'm being a little biased as shown ovbiously there are some bugs here or there due to when the game was made but nothing game breaking maybe just a moment where in the boss fight they repeat dialogue or get stuck here or there. So rating this game off of it's time and pure nostalgia. 10/10 off of comparison to games now 4/10 however that wouldn't do this game right so yes i recommend it this game,

Crikey! I cannot belive that I'm playing the classic Return To Castle Wolfenstein again. I first played this back in the days of Windows XP ten years ago. Sure, the graphics are dated but it's still has that old-school charm about it. It still makes me creep out on occassion when I have to go down in those creepy catacombs where the scary things are. Yes,..I'm a very jumpy type of person and this game still makes the hairs stand on the back of my neck Lol. There is a fantastic tutorial on how to get this working in modern full-screen 16.9 mode for todays modern widescreen monitors. I still rate this game as one of the best all time classic shooters as an agent who works alone dealing with the Nazis and the occult.
So many hours I lost playing this game in my twenties!!!...and now I can do it all over again in my thirties!!!

Does a fast shooter that's half Quake and half classic WWII fps sound fun? Do you think WWII could have been livened up alot more by cybernetically augmented abominations and zombies? THEN THIS GAME IS FOR YOU!  Holds up quite well, other then the craptacular forest level which is one of the worst stealth scenarios I recall ever being put in. A lot of fun, and really hard, even on the easiest difficulty.

Reminds me old times. Each mission was a lot of fun and you got a choice between stealth and full agression. It´s pretty challenging on harder difficulties - even stealth. I highly advise to play this before you will take a look on Wolfenstein: The New Other.
I must have first played this when I was about six at my grandparents. I never noticed it on Steam untill it was on sale. I couldn't pass this classic of my time. Yes, I'm young. lel.

Return to Castle Wolfenstein is a borderline Recommend (call it 3 stars out of 5). First, the good: the story that drives the game is a good one and, for a game initially released back in 2001, the graphics are pretty good. The cut-scenes and voice acting are also pretty good. The initial key-binding are awful, but with a little effort they can be made to approximate current bindings.  Now, for the less-than-good: there's nothing really wrong with the game, but the fact that the player can't affect the outcome in any way drags it down for me. Specifically, most levels have Secret Areas (SAs) and Treasures. But, whether or not you enter those SAs or pick up any Treasures is irrelevant. You get nothing useful outside of the box saying you've found all the SAs/Treasures when you leave the level (and maybe some additional health, ammo, or armor). Also, even though I used 'Return to Castle Wolfenstein Single Player v1.42c Unofficial Patch' to fix various bugs and allow me to use my standard 1920x1200 resolution, I still ran across a few glitches associated with those SAs. Specifically, in one case, even though I found, opened and looted a certain SA, the game refused to give me the credit for it. In another case, when I entered one SA, I couldn't manage to leave it. Also, in every level, you can go back to search for the SAs once you've cleared the it of enemies. Except for one level. But, again, that means nothing to how the game plays out.  So, all-in-all, it's an OK game. If you favor straight shooters over more quest-driven action games, you'll probably like this better than I did. It's currently listing for about $10 and is on sale for $5. At $5, it's a buy. At $10, you might want to think about it a bit.
A old classic game, very fun.
run around and shoot Nazis
For nostalgia reasons. only thing i didnt like is that there is no option to increase the resolution to 1920x1080 or make wide screen.

I was a bit hesitent at first whether to buy Return to Castle Wolfenstein at first. But now that i have played it, I can say that has grown on me alot. It has already taken place beside my most favorite FPS games such as Medal of Honor: Underground & Arma: Cold War Assault. I would highly recommend Return to Castle Wolfenstein to anybody who likes FPS games or who is a fan of the Wolfentein Franchise.  Overall 9/10
Classic game!

Pros: Large arsenal of enjoyable and effective weapons Solid level design Super snappy controls as is to be expected from anything built on Quake III Nice selection of enemies  Cons: I'm not one to complain much about graphics, but RtCW is ugly as sin. The game has more brown and grey then a concrete restroom at Taco Bell. Wolfenstein 3D has more colors. The forced stealth level at the begining of mission 2  Despite being almost 15 years old RtCW has held up incredibly well. Gunplay is tight and fluid and the weapon selection can pretty much fit any play style or situation. Level flow is very good, nither feeling overly confusing or like someone is shoving you down a linear hallway. If you're a FPS fan pick it up. It does not disappoint.

I recommend this game – next time it is 75% off in a steam sale, pick it up! Works fine on Windows Vista, at least. The graphics are obviously a little old looking now, but the levels are still fun to head around and some of the secrets feel rewarding to find. There’s a few times in the games where you get your weapons/armour reset so once you’ve played once you can remember those times and use up all of the ammo etc in the last level before the re-set. When I had this game the first time round the multiplayer was a lot of fun, but it seems to be a pain to get running and find other players now. Might as well play free Team Fortress 2 for that. Took me less than ten hours to go through single player with a lot of the secrets from memory, but if you didn’t play it before you could get more time out of it – and at 75% off it is pennies per hour of entertainment!
Cool game. I played since 1994.
One of the best FPS on this planet. Must have! 10/10
uninspired game plus uninspired gameplay however fake german accents make up for it
Nothing in life feels better than turning a Nazi into a bucket of fried chicken with the toss of a grenade. Well... at the very least it's a close second to hot meals  10/10

It is playable on tablet too. What else? nothing!  8.5/10!!

I played this game like 10 years ago, and i loved it.  Now i bought it to remember it, and i loved to finish it again after all this time.  Its a classic, a must have on your library.

RTCW is simply one of the best first person shooters ever made. Even now mid way through 2014, the game still looks spectacular and the level design and ai are stellar. So if you like your WWII shooter mixed with a lot of Dr. Frankenstein, than what are you wating for?  RTCW is a must play - period. (And that 88 metacritic score should actually be a 95 by the way).

This game was revolutionary for its time with its sneaky elements and up-close personal FPS style, and it still holds up today. Being the first Wolfenstein game to involve stealth, Id Software pulled it off amazingly.  Pros: -Cool stealth missions -Strategic combat -Actually takes skill -Freakin' Nazis  Cons: -Graphics, cutscenes, and audio is a bit dated, but is only a signifigant problem if that kind of stuff bothers you. -Mein Leben  9/10

This game looks more of a mod to Quake 3, as they share the same mechanic. But the gameplay is very interesting and the story as well. They have cutscenes too. They have multiplayer so feel free to try it out. If you are more interested in the story, then i would recommend it. On highest difficulty in the story the enemies are better at aiming and quick at reacting. You dont lose alot of hp like previous wolfenstein games, but regardless its STILL hard. So good luck when playing this.  Also, comparing to previous oldschool Wolfenstein games, this has alot of changes so expect that.

I must have played this game about a decade ago albeit it the demo version. Stuff that shouldn't freak me out (doors opening into my face amongst other things) did so. Things that were meant to freak me out (some of the paranormal stuff) still does. It's a classic. I still haven't completed it

What can I say, for its age this is still a fun game. The attention to detail is what makes it rise above its time. In the words of Aldo the Apache... 'You probably heard we ain't in the prisoner-takin' business; we in the killin' Nazi business. And cousin, business is a-boomin'.

A classic FPS with a great story, interesting levels, nice weapons, amusing dialogue and some tough enemies. Anyone looking for some quality old-school gameplay need look no further.
A Good Old Classic That Could Beat Any Call Of Duty Hands Down .

Excellent game that holds up really well after all these years. It retains a lot of elements that made Wolfenstein 3D unique, but does so much to elevate the franchise and be a special entry on its own. It has great level design, fun a.i., immersive soundscape and it doesn't treat you like a complete idiot like The New Order does.
